shortdesc.ph: Describes information about externally encoded video frames.
Contains information about externally encoded video frames.

plentry.pd: Codec type of the local video stream. See .
Width of the video frame (in pixels).
Height of the video frame (in pixels).
Frames per second of the video frame. When this parameter is not 0, it can be used to calculate the Unix timestamp of the externally encoded video frame.
Type of the video frame. See .
Rotation information of the video frame. See .
Reserved parameter for future support of multiple video tracks.
Capture timestamp of the externally encoded video frame (in milliseconds, Unix timestamp).
Decode timestamp of the externally encoded video frame (in milliseconds, Unix timestamp).
Type of the video stream. See .

pd.note: In certain scenarios, such as when the captured video stream has low resolution or the device has limited performance, the SDK automatically switches to H.264 encoding.

plentry.pd: Width of the video frame (in pixels).
Height of the video frame (in pixels).
Frames per second of the video frame. When this parameter is not 0, you can use it to calculate the Unix timestamp of the externally encoded video frame.

Video frame type:
0 (default): VIDEO_FRAME_TYPE_BLANK_FRAME, blank frame.
3: VIDEO_FRAME_TYPE_KEY_FRAME, key frame.
4: VIDEO_FRAME_TYPE_DELTA_FRAME, delta frame.
5: VIDEO_FRAME_TYPE_B_FRAME, B frame.
6: VIDEO_FRAME_TYPE_UNKNOW, unknown frame.

Rotation angle of the video frame:
0 (default): 0 degrees.
90: 90 degrees.
180: 180 degrees.
270: 270 degrees.
Unix timestamp (in milliseconds) when the externally encoded video frame was captured.
Output parameter indicating the timestamp (in milliseconds) when the video frame was decoded.
